meanings.definition: To bring or transport something to a destination.
meanings.sent1: The mail carrier will deliver the package to our house.
meanings.sent2: Please deliver this letter to the post office.
meanings.sent3: The pizza delivery person forgot to deliver the garlic knots!
meanings.sent4: Her speech was like a delivery of wisdom to the audience.
meanings.sent5: The truck driver must deliver the goods before sunset.

meanings.definition: To hand over or transfer something to someone.
meanings.sent1: I will deliver the keys to you tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer will deliver the documents to the court.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to deliver the rabbit, but it disappeared!
meanings.sent4: She delivered the news with a sense of urgency.
meanings.sent5: The messenger must deliver the secret message to the king.

meanings.sent1: The store will deliver the groceries to our home.
meanings.sent2: Can you deliver the presentation slides to me by noon?
meanings.sent3: The chef will deliver a delicious meal for the event.
meanings.sent4: His promise to deliver results was met with skepticism.
meanings.sent5: The company must deliver quality products to its customers.

meanings.definition: To give birth to a baby.
meanings.sent1: The doctor will help the mother deliver her baby safely.
meanings.sent2: She delivered a healthy baby boy last night.
meanings.sent3: The stork was supposed to deliver the baby, not the doctor!
meanings.sent4: The anticipation of delivering a child is both exciting and nerve-wracking.
meanings.sent5: The midwife's expertise helped the mother deliver without complications.

meanings.definition: To rescue or save someone from harm.
meanings.sent1: The lifeguard will deliver the swimmer from drowning.
meanings.sent2: Firefighters deliver people from burning buildings.
meanings.sent3: The superhero swooped in to deliver the citizens from danger.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking delivered her friend from a dangerous situation.
meanings.sent5: The paramedics deliver life-saving care to those in need.
